item.title: Just Wonderful
item.dc:creator: Brian Kirsten
item.content:encoded: From the BBC: "President Bush authorised the leak of secret intelligence to the New York Times to help defend the war in Iraq, a former top White House aide has said. The claim comes from Lewis “Scooter” Libby, the former chief-of-staff to Vice-President Dick Cheney. Mr Libby is facing trial for allegedly obstructing an investigation into a different leak. He is accused of lying to prosecutors investigating who revealed the name of CIA agent Valerie Plame to the press. " Read the full article. (Link courtesy of Warren Ellis - Subscribe to the Warren Ellis Blog via BlogBuzzMachine.)
